name: ebFRET
tagline: ebFRET performs combined analysis on multiple single-molecule FRET time series to learn a set of rates and states
body:
### Consensus analysis of many single-molecule FRET time series

ebFRET is a library written in Matlab for the analysis of single-molecule FRET time series with hidden Markov models. It the successor of [vbFRET](vbfret.sourceforge.net), which it improves upon by allowing analysis of multiple time series at once. This approach, known as _empirical Bayes_, is both more accurate and statistically robust, and is suitable to more advanced experimental use cases, such as the detection of kinetically distinct sub-populations in an experiment. 

### Read the Paper

_Hierarchically-coupled hidden Markov models for learning kinetic rates from single-molecule data_
Jan-Willem van de Meent (@jwvdm), Jonathan Bronson, Frank Wood, Ruben Gonzalez, Chris Wiggins (@chrishwiggins)

### Example Usage
```
data = load_fret('my_data.dat')
eb = eb_fret(data.fret, [2,3,4], 10);
tracePlotter(data.fret, 'vit', eb.vit);
```
